pages.content: Mars| is a| planet| in our| solar| system.
It is| the fourth| planet| from| the sun.

Mars| is also| known| as the| “Red Planet”.| 
It is| red| because| the soil| looks like| rusty| iron.
Mars| is small.| It is| the second| smallest| planet| in the solar| system.| It’s about| half| the size| of Earth.
Mars| orbits| the sun| every| 687| days.| One year| on Mars| is 1.9| Earth| years.
Mars| spins| while it| orbits| the sun.| The spin| makes day| and night.| One spin| takes| 24 hours| and 37| minutes.
Mars| has| very weak| gravity.| You could| jump around| three times| higher| on Mars| than you can| on Earth.
Mars| is a| terrestrial| planet| because| it has| a hard| and rocky| surface.| Red dust| covers| almost| all of Mars.
Mars| has a| thin| atmosphere.| It is| very cold.
Mars| has| two moons.| Their names| are| Phobos| and Deimos.
There is| no evidence| of life| on Mars.| However,| it is| the planet| with the best| conditions| to support| life.| Because| scientists| recently| found| water ice| just under| the surface.

One day,| humans| might be| able to live| on Mars.|
Would you| want to| go there?
